title: Dataproc - Dataproc optional Hive WebHCat component
abstract:
# Dataproc - Dataproc optional Hive WebHCat component
You can install additional components like Hive WebHCat when you create a Dataproc cluster using the [Optional components](/dataproc/docs/concepts/components/overview#available_optional_components) feature. This page describes the Hive WebHCat component.
The [Hive WebHCat](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/WebHCat) component provides a REST API for HCatalog. The REST service is available on port `50111` on the cluster's first master node.
content:
## Install the component
Install the component when you create a Dataproc cluster. Components can be added to clusters created with Dataproc [version 1.3](/dataproc/docs/concepts/versioning/dataproc-release-1.3) and later.
See [Supported Dataproc versions](/dataproc/docs/concepts/versioning/dataproc-versions#supported_cloud_dataproc_versions) for the component version included in each Dataproc image release.
To create a Dataproc cluster that includes the Hive WebHCat component, use the [gcloud dataproc clusters create](/sdk/gcloud/reference/dataproc/clusters/create)  command with the `--optional-components` flag.
```
gcloud dataproc clusters create cluster-name \
    --optional-components=HIVE_WEBHCAT \
    --region=region \
    ... other args
```
The Hive WebHCat component can be specified through the Dataproc API using
 [SoftwareConfig.Component](/dataproc/docs/reference/rest/v1/ClusterConfig#Component) 
as part of a
 [clusters.create](/dataproc/docs/reference/rest/v1/projects.regions.clusters/create) 
request.
- Enable the component.- In the Google Cloud console, open the Dataproc [Create a cluster](https://console.cloud.google.com/dataproc/clustersAdd) page. The Set up cluster panel is selected.
- In the Components section, under Optional components, select Hive   WebHCat and other optional components to install on your cluster.
